definition: to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: When the markets opened the following Monday, the Dow bid adieu to 10000 for good.
sentences.chinese: 股市在緊接着的週一開盤時就告別了10000點。

sentences.english: She will give a touching valediction at graduation.
sentences.chinese: 她將在畢業典禮作感人的告別演講。

sentences.english: She left without saying goodbye to us .
sentences.chinese: 她沒向我們告別就走了。

sentences.english: Since I hope to see you again, I'll say au revoir rather than adieu.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我希望再次見你，我將說再見，而非告別。

sentences.english: Hope that my good friends, should 88 bars when parting from network game's all urgently.
sentences.chinese: 希望我的好朋友們，該告別網絡遊戲的都急時88吧。

sentences.english: What sort of farewell is that?
I stood and smiled and offered Jeanine a handshake.
sentences.chinese: 我笑着站了起來，並伸手出去和珍妮握手告別。

sentences.english: This woman just finished the farewell ceremony for his husband, came back home to want to accept a letter.
sentences.chinese: 這位婦女剛爲他先生辦完告別式，一回到家想收個信。

sentences.english: Take advantage of exit interviews, and diplomatically explain your stance.
sentences.chinese: 好好利用告別的面談，婉轉的解釋你的立場。

sentences.english: They bid farewell to the original suffer hunger and cold days.
sentences.chinese: 他們告別了當初飢寒交迫的日子。

sentences.english: Therefore, Jay and David said goodbye to each other and promised to get together again on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 因此，阿杰跟戴維彼此告別，並相約週六再見。

sentences.english: The fisherman left the villagers and went home. But he could never find the place again.
sentences.chinese: 漁人告別村民回家以後，再也找不到這個地方了。

sentences.english: I come here to say good-bye only.
I hope you enjoy the farewell waltz.
sentences.chinese: 希望你們享受這個告別的華爾茲。

sentences.english: Professor Lu Yang stood on the plane's entrance and waved good-bye to us.
sentences.chinese: 陸楊教授站在飛機的登機口前向我們揮手告別。

sentences.english: Everyone had gathered to say “GOOD-BYE” to the place where we had spent our schooldays.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都聚在一起，向我們度過校園生活的地方告別。

definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
to take a curtain call/(fig.) to come to an end
